p: All the mosquitoes' vital rates (birth, death, and transition) depend on temperature and/or precipitation ( 26). In addition, the egg-to-larva hatching fraction depends on the larval population and environmental carrying capacity, due to competition for survival ( 27). The whole lifecycle from egg to adult takes one to a few weeks on average, depending on temperature and precipitation ( 20). Those temperature dependent parameters are obtained from laboratory studies ( 28) and precipitation dependent parameters were modeled ( 20) and validated against local dengue outbreaks ( 25).
